sugar, powdered sugar, powdered sugar, powdered sugar, powdered sugar, powdered sugar

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a large cookie sheet. Beat butter and sugar in a large bowl with mixer at high speed, until light and fluffy. Add egg and vanilla. Beat until well blended. Combine flour, cocoa, cream of tartar, baking soda and salt in a medium bowl. Add to butter mixture. Mix until uniform. Mix in chopped cherries. Drop dough by tablespoonfuls onto prepared cookie sheet. Bake about 10-12 minutes or until set.

Heat oil in skillet or wok, add garlic, ginger, steak, salt& pepper, cook 3 minutes. Add curry coriander and onion, saute 3 minutes. Add tomatoes, simmer until liquid evaporates. Remove from heat. Add yogurt. Adjust seasonings to taste.

Preheat oven to 350f. Mix all ingredients, except salmon, together. Pour a small amount of the mix into the bottom of a baking pan - just enough to lightly cover the bottom. Add the salmon, and pour the remaining mix over top. Bake for about 20 minutes, or until salmon flakes easily with a fork.

Heat oven to 425. Start frying bacon or sausage. Combine first 5 ingredients, then cut in butter. Make a well in the center and pour in milk. Stir until well combined and moist. Turn dough out onto floured surface and knead until dough holds together well and is pliable. Press into bottom of a greased 9 x 13 pan. Beat the eggs with a splash of milk and pour over biscuit crust. Sprinkle crumbled bacon or sausage over the egg mixture and top with cheese. Bake for 16 - 20 minutes, or until egg is cooked through.

Preheat oven to 180 degree celsius. Lightly grease and line a 20cm cake tin and line with baking paper. In a bowl combine the flour, oats, bicarbonate of soda, allspice, sugar and pecans. Make a well in the centre and then add the oil and egg and then the apples and combine all ingredients well together. Pour mix into the prepared tin and cook for 35 minutes until golden brown.

In a large non-stick skillet over medium heat, melt butter and olive oil together. Add the remaining ingredients to the skillet. Stir until potatoes are evenly coated with spice mixture and onion slices are evenly distributed. Cook covered on medium heat for 15 minutes, tossing and turning the potatoes every few minutes. Potatoes will be done when slightly browned and fork-tender.

Preheat oven to 400f. Place wax paper on a large baking sheet. Combine dry ingredients in a second bowl. Combine other ingredients in a second bowl. Blend the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Add chocolate chips. Drop by large spoonfuls onto the baking sheet. Bake 15 minutes.

Combine egg noodles, cream of mushroom soup, chicken broth, dry sherry, cooked chicken, sharp cheddar cheese, slivered almonds, chopped pimiento, sliced mushrooms, salt and pepper. Bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour. Uncover 10 minutes before done and let brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium mixing bowl, combine all ingredients in a medium mixing bowl. Beat for two minutes. Pour into a cake pan and bake for about 30 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out dry. Meanwhile make the chocolate glaze. Combine all ingredients in a saucepan and cook over medium heat until it begins to boil, stirring constantly. It should be thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. When the cake is done let it cool. Once it is cool to touch, pour the chocolate glaze over it and let it harden a bit. Serve and enjoy.

Preheat oven to 500f. Rinse, drain and hull berries. Turn into bowl and sprinkle with sugar and lemon juice. Toss gently to coat. Turn coated berries into shallow casserole or 10-inch ovenproof skillet and arrange in a single layer. Roast, stirring twice, until berries are just softened and syrup forms, about 5 minutes. Remove from oven. Stir in framboise. Let cool 5 to 10 minutes. Divide ice cream between 4 bowls. Spoon warm berries and sauce over top. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray bundt pan with non stick cooking spray. Combine all ingredients in bowl using hand mixer, until well blended. The apples should be pretty well pulverized. Pour into bundt pan. Bake for approximately 40 minutes.

Place potatoes, onion, carrot and meat in a pressure cooker and cook on high setting for 1 hour or until potatoes are tender. Or, cover and cook on high setting one hour. Reduce to low setting, and cook 7 hours. Remove the hot pot from the oven

Wash and trim the sprouts, cut an x in the core end. In a large saucepan, bring 1 inch of water and the sprouts to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 10 to 12 minutes or until fork tender. In a small microwave safe dish, melt the butter and blend in lemon juice, dill weed and lemon zest. Drain the sprouts, return to pan and dry over heat for 1 to 2 minutes. Pour the butter mixture over, tossing to coat, stir in chopped almonds. Enjoy.

Heat 1 tbs oil in a saucepan and fry ginger and garlic paste for approx 2 minute, making sure not to brown the paste. Add hot water. Wash the lentils and put into the water. Add salt and tsp of turmeric. Bring to boil then lower heat and cook for 10 to 15 minutes, stirring once or twice. Heat oil in another saucepan and fry onion till light brown. Add onions and fried seed mixture to lentils, stir through. Serve with basmati rice.

In 13x9-inch pan, layer the cubes of cake, packing them tightly together. Cream together cream cheese and sugar. Fold in cool whip. Spread over the cake cubes in pan. Spread pie filling over top of cream cheese mixture. Sprinkle with nuts, if desired. Refrigerate until serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar & baking powder. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in milk just until flour mixture is moistened. It will be very thick and pull away from the sides of the bowl. Spoon into greased muffin pan. Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from pan and let cool.

Preheat oven to 350f line a baking sheet with parchment paper & set aside. Combine flour, oats, sugar, baking soda, salt and cinnamon in a medium bowl and stir with a fork to blend. Add butter and vanilla. Blend with fork until stiff dough forms. Use your hands to mix in the raisins. Divide dough in half and place halves four inches apart on baking sheet. Bake until lightly browned. Remove sheet from oven & transfer the parchment to a cooling rack to cool for 15 minutes. Transfer cookies to wire rack and cool completely.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Remove the casserole dish from the oven and place it on a wire rack in the center of the casserole dish. Bake for about 20 minutes or until the cheese is completely melted.

Preheat the oven to 425f. In a large bowl combine the pumpkin puree, condensed milk, eggs, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg. Mix well and turn into the crust. Bake 15 minutes. Reduce the oven temperature to 350 and bake another 35 to 40 minutes or until a knife inserted 1-inch from the edge comes out clean. Cool before cutting. Garnish with whipped cream. Refrigerate leftovers.

Heat butter and oil in a large saucepan. Add onion and cook over low heat until soft. Add garlic and cook for a further 30 seconds. Add curry paste cook for 30 seconds. Add stock. Simmer for 15 minutes. Cool slightly before pureeing. Return to the heat and stir in the yoghurt. Serve drizzled with cream and with pappadums.

Preheat oven 425 degrees f. Combine all ingredients and knead ten times. Let stand for ten minutes. Put dough on a cookie sheet and roll or press out. Top with toppings. Bake 20-25 minutes or until edges are golden.

In a large skillet, saute the chicken in butter until no longer pink. Stir in the soup, water, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and stin in sour cream. Serve over toasted basil. Can also serve over cooked noodles. Sprinkle with cayenne pepper or paprika.

Heat olive oil over medium heat. Saut crushed garlic for 1-2 minutes. Stir in tomato sauce. Add salt, pepper, and pesto. Add cream cheese and stir or whisk well until fully melted. Stir parmesan cheese until melted. Add cream and stir well.

Cook beef, bell pepper and onion in a large saucepan over medium heat, crumbling the meat with a wooden spoon, until the meat is browned, 8 to 10 minutes. Add garlic, chili powder, cumin and cayenne. Cook until fragrant, about 15 seconds. Stir in beans and cook until heated through, about 1 minute.
Combine sugar and water and bring to the boil. Simmer 5 minutes to make a syrup. Allow to cool. Combine berry puree with lemon juice and syrup. Place in a metal bowl or tray. Freeze till set.

Wash the rice in a sieve under cold water, then leave to drain about 15 minutes. Heat the oil in a large saucepan and fry the onion for a few minutes over a moderate heat until soft. Add the rice and stir-fry for about 10 minutes, taking care to keep stirring all the time so that the rice doesnt stick to the pan. Add the garlic and the stock or water and stir well. Bring to the boil and cook over a high heat for 5 minutes, then reduce the heat, cover and cook the rice for 20 minutes. Scatter the corn over the rice, then spread the pepper on top and lastly sprinkle over the grated carrot. Cover tightly and steam over a low heat until the rice is cooked, then mix together with a fork and serve immediately.

Combine dressing ingredients and heat until it comes to a boil. Let cool and refrigerate. Melt butter in frying pan. Brown broken noodles, almonds, and sesame seeds in butter. Set aside. Keep dressing, dry mixture, and cabbage seperate. Mix all 3 together 15 minutes before serving. This is best served cold and fresh.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add eggs, cream, cubanelle pepper, roma tomatoes, extra virgin olive oil, feta cheese, salt and pepper. Cook for about 2 minutes over medium-high heat. Take the seeds out of the tomatoes and squeeze slightly to remove excess juice. Then chop and add the tomatoes, salt and pepper. Cook for another 7-8 minutes, stirring occasionally. Mix the eggs with the cream in a bowl, and pour into the pan. Then add the feta cheese. Keep stirring occasionally until the eggs are done. Make sure you dont overcook, otherwise it will be dry. Serve with bread.

In a plastic container with a lid, combine all ingredients. Seal and place in the freezer until frozen solid. Take out of freezer and let thaw. Drink when it has thawed and is slushy. Or put in blender and blend until slushy. Garnish with fresh cranberries, zest of a lime or an orange slice.
In small bowl, combine all ingredients. Beat at low speed until smooth. Cover and refrigerate for several hours to blend flavors. Combine salad ingredients in large bowl. Serve with dressing.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Line a greased 9x9 pan with bread. Combine broccoli with margarine, cheese, salt, tobasco, and onion. Spoon over bread. Beat eggs, add milk powder and water, mix well, pour over broccoli. Bake at for 20-25 minutes.

In a medium bowl, combine carrots, sugar, salt, coriander seed, black pepper, garlic clove, chili powder, white vinegar, oil. Toss to combine. In a small bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Spoon over carrot mixture. Mix well. Chill several hours or overnight. Mix before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a 9 inch glass pie dish, toss together apples, apricots and brandy. Sprinkle oat mixture evenly over top and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until apples are tender and topping is browned.

Preheat oven to 350, or 325 if you have dark non-stick pan. Prepare pan whichever way. In a bowl, cream together sugar and butter. Add the sifted flour and baking powder. Beat in eggs. Stir in vanilla. Finally, stir in milk until batter is smooth. Bake for about 30-40 minutes, until cake springs back at touch.

To make sparkling summer tea, combine 2 cups of sugar and 2 cups of water over medium-high heat in a saucepan until the sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and let cool completely before using. To store, refrigerate up to 2 months. In a glass, combine 2 cups of sugar and 2 cups of water over medium-high heat in a saucepan until the sugar is dissolved. In a glass, combine

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the asparagus, butter, flour, fresh lemon juice, salt, hot pepper sauce, curry powder, sour cream, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon zest, lemon z
Combine all ingredients in a blender or food processor. Whirl until smooth. Place in jar with tight-fitting lid. Refrigerate for up to two weeks. Shake well before serving.

Heat oil in a 10-inch skillet over medium heat. Cook broccoli, onion, garlic and carrot in oil about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until broccoli is crisp- tender. Stir in chicken, salt, and tomatoes. Cook about 3 minutes, stirring occasionally, just until chicken is hot. Toss with pasta. Sprinkle with cheese and parsley.

Mix cornbread-muffin mix, milk, eggs, deli ham, cheddar cheese, cream of chicken soup, butter, cream of chicken soup, butter, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken soup, cream of chicken

Heat oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Add carrots, potatoes, garlic, fresh parsley, caraway seed, italian dressing, salt and pepper. Cook for 5-6 minutes or until carrots are tender. Remove from heat and set aside.

In a large saute pan over medium-high heat, warm the olive oil. Add the onions and using tongs, toss them until they are wilted but still retain their bright colour, about 3-4 minutes. Add the vinegar, garlic, red pepper flakes, salt and black pepper to taste and toss well. Transfer to a warmed serving bowl and serve immediately.

Place lamb in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes or until lamb is tender. Remove from heat and set aside to cool.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the seitan, carrots, broccoli, soba noodles, tamari, teriyaki sauce, vegetable oil and cook for 1 minute. Add

Heat butter in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, 5-8 minutes. Add the cauliflower and cook, stirring occasionally, until light golden brown, about 5 minutes. Add the stock, milk, nutmeg, and pepper and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until the cauliflower is easily pierced with a fork, about 10 minutes. Remove 1 cup of cauliflower florets and set aside., puree soup in blender or food processor until smooth. Return soup to pot and stir in the cheese and remaining cauliflower florets and adjust seasonings to taste.

Muddle mint leaves, 1 lime wedge and simple syrup. Add ice, rum and pomegranate molasses. Shake. Pour into collins glass. Top with ice. Garnish with mint and pomegranate molasses. Serve in a 12oz hurricane glass.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Arrange the potatoes and the red and green peppers alternately in a spoke pattern in a shallow, 12-inch round baking dish. Pile the onions in the center. Scatter the garlic over the top. Drizzle with oil, and sprinkle with rosemary, salt and black pepper. Bake in the preheated oven until the vegetables are lightly golden and tender, or about 45 minutes. Garnish with fresh rosemary sprigs.

Preheat oven to 350. In mixing bowl, combine chowder, eggs, cheese, onions, parsley, pepper. Blend well. Set empty piecrust on baking sheet on extended oven rack. Ladle chowder mixture into crust. Carefully slide rack back into place. Bake 1 hour or till set. Cool 10 minutes before slicing.

Combine the sugar, cider vinegar, granulated garlic, onion flakes, celery seed, fresh parsley, lemon juice, garbanzo beans in a food processor or blender. Process for 20 seconds. Add the sugar, cider vinegar, granulated garlic, onion flakes, celery seed, fresh parsley, lemon juice, garbanzo beans in a food processor or blender. Process for another 20 seconds.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease two 9x5 inch loaf pans. Sift together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and pumpkin pie spice. Set aside. In a large bowl, beat together sugar, oil, eggs, and pumpkin. Stir in flour mixture alternately with water. Divide batter evenly between the prepared pans. Bake in the preheated oven for 60 to 70 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. For best flavor, store wrapped in plastic wrap at room temperature for a full day before serving.

Wash lentils and rice. In a pan, saute onion in oil until it is a golden brown. Add the lentils, rice, salt, butter, onion, soup, and water. Bring to a boil and then turn to low heat and simmer for 1-2 hours, making sure to add more water as it absorbs. Lentils will be soft when ready.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cook noodles in accordance with package and drain. In a medium mixing bowl, combine melted soup and milk and stir until well blended. In 13 x 9 baking dish, combine ham, cooked noodles, liquid soup mixture and half of the cheese. Bake for 20 minutes. Sprinkle remaining cheese over top of casserole. Dot with butter. Bake for additional 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

Preheat oven to 350. In a large bowl mix the breadcrumbs, parmesan, parsley, salt, pepper, lemon juice, garlic powder, butter. Dip the chicken breasts in the melted butter. Dip the chicken in the breaded mix. Brush lemon juice onto the tops of the chicken. Place chicken on a baking sheet and bake at 350 for one hour.

Place cauliflower, carrots, red onion, capers, fresh parsley, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, olive oil, mayonnaise

Place chicken in a shallow 2 quart baking dish sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. In a small bowl, combine the picante sauce, brown sugar and mustard. Pour over chicken. Bake, uncovered at 400 degrees for 30 to 35 minutes or until juices from the chicken run clear. Serve over rice.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Place the pecan halves on a baking sheet and bake until just crisp, about 10 minutes. Let cool. Crumble the pecan halves into a container and store in the refrigerator. In a blender, combine the orange zest, orange juice, balsamic vinegar, honey, garlic clove, salt, fresh ground black pepper, extra virgin olive oil, spinachpreparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. In a blender, combine the orange zest, orange juice, balsamic vinegar, honey, garlic clove, salt
Saute onions in butter. Add flour, salt, sugar and pepper. Mix in sour cream, beans and cheese. Pour into 9x13 baking dish. Top with cornflakes. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Sprinkle cheese in 9x9 inch square baking dish. Dot with butter. Mix cream, mustard, salt, and pepper, and pour half of the mixture over the cheese. Pour eggs on top. Pour remaining cream mixture over the eggs. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes until light golden brown. Cool on a rack before turning muffins out of pan.

Mix flour, salt, and pepper together. Add butter to pan to prevent sticking. Lightly toast bread on both sides. Put cheese directly in pan to slightly melt. After cheese is slightly melted, place cheese on bread using a spatula. Fold bread over onto instelf. Place grilled cheese on plate and eat.

Place potatoes in a heavy large pan and cover with water, just to cover. Boil until soft but not mushy. Pour about half of the water off of the potatoes, but save half, the starch that boils off the potatoes helps the soup to thicken and holds more nutrients. Add yogurt and spices and simmer 5-10 minutes to let the flavors mingle, and serve. I like a little shredded cheese in mine, grew up with cheddar, but like mozzarella now.

In a small bowl, mix together cream cheese, mango chutney, milk, curry powder, dry roasted peanuts, cream cheese, mango chutney, milk, curry powder, dry roasted peanuts, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango chutney, cream cheese, mango

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut filets into 3 - 4 oz portions. Melt butter. Crush ritz crackers into crumb size pieces. Mix together dry ingredients. Dip halibut into melted butter then into cracker mixture. Place on baking sheet. Pour remaining melted butter over halibut. Bake at 400 degrees for 12 - 15 minutes or until flaky when touched with a fork.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Whisk together the olive oil, honeydew melon, blue cheese, dry white wine, hot mustard, orange, salt and pepper. Cut the tomatoes in half and toss to combine with the olive oil mixture. Spread the tomatoes in a roasting pan and place in the oven. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes or until the tomatoes are shrivelled. Break the ends from the asparagus at their natural breaking point. Add the tender lengths of asparagus to the tomatoes and continue to cook for 25 minutes or until the asparagus is tender.

Preheat oven to 400f. Place peppers on baking sheet. Bake for 3-4 minutes until crisp. Spread peppers evenly over peppers. Spread taco sauce evenly over peppers. Top with any additional ingredients. Bake for 7-8 minutes. Cut into wedges and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Grease muffin cups or use paper liners. Mix maple syrup, egg, maple syrup, flour, baking powder and salt in a large bowl. Whisk eggs and brown sugar in another bowl. When smooth, whisk in milk, melted butter and vanilla. Pour over dry ingredients and fold in just until dry ingredients are moistened. Scoop into mufifn cups. Bake 15 to 25 minutes or until springy to the touch in the center.

Bring about 6 cups water to a boil and pour over rice in a bowl. Soak rice until it has turned a more opaque white, 2 to 3 minutes. Drain well and spread out on a kitchen towel to dry, at least one hour. Cook onion and garlic in oil in a wide 4-5 quart heavy pot or deep skillet over med. Heat, stirring, until softened, about 3 minutes. Add rice and cook over med-high heat, stirring, until pale golden, about 5 minute add broth, water, and 2 teaspoons salt and bring to a boil. Cover tightly and cook over low heat until rice is tender, 18-20 minutes. Let stand covered 5 min., then fluff with fork and serve.

In medium mixing bowl with mixer on low. Cream peanutbutter until soft. Gradually add milk while continuely to mix. When all milk is mixed with peanutbutter, add pudding mix and continue to blend until ingredients are smooth and combined well. Pour mix into baked shell, chill at least 4 hours.

Melt butter in pan over a medium flame and seal meat on both sides. Continue cooking for a further 2 minutes transfer steaks to bbq & cook to desired degree. Add chives to pan and cook over a low heat for 1 minute. Sprinkle in flour and stir to combine. Add remaining ingredients and simmer gently until just thickened. Serve steaks with whiskey sauce.

In a large skillet combine carrots, water, and 1 tablespoon of the butter. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat to medium. Cover and cook for 6 to 8 minutes or until carrots are nearly tender, stirring to glaze carrots. Just before serving, sprinkle with parsley.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a small bowl, soak the apricots in brandy for 5 minutes. Blend flour, brown sugar, salt and butter until mixture resembles coarse meal. Add oats and almonds and toss. In a 9 inch glass pie dish, toss together apples, apricots and brandy. Sprinkle oat mixture evenly over top and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until apples are tender and topping is browned.

Combine dressing ingredients and heat until it comes to a boil. Let cool and refrigerate. Melt butter in frying pan. Brown broken noodles, almonds, and sesame seeds in butter. Set aside. Keep dressing, dry mixture, and cabbage seperate. Mix all 3 together 15 minutes before serving. This is best served cold and fresh.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease muffin cups or line with paper muffin liners. Stir together flour, sugar, baking soda and baking powder. In a separate bowl, combine oats, flours, baking powder and salt in a large bowl. Whisk eggs and brown sugar in another bowl. When smooth, whisk in milk, melted butter and vanilla. Pour over dry ingredients and fold in just until dry ingredients are moistened. Scoop into mufifn cups. Bake 15 to 25 minutes or until springy to the touch in the center.

Preheat oven to 350f. Mix all the dry ingredients together. Mix everything together. Shape into 8-12 balls, put on cooked sheet lined with parchement. Flatten slightly. Leave room between them because the will spread out. Bake for 10-12 minutes at 350f.

Preheat oven to 400f. Place wax paper on a large baking sheet. Combine dry ingredients in a large bowl. Combine other ingredients in a second bowl. Blend the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Add yogurt all at once, stir with fork to make a soft slightly stick dough. Cut in to rounds and bake 425f degrees for 12-15 minutes or until cooked.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Combine the water, salt, pasta, whole milk, sugar, butter in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for an additional 5 minutes. Add the milk, and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Add the pasta, and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Add the pasta,

Preheat oven to 400. Over medium heat melt butter then blend in flour, salt and pepper. Slowly mix in milk, stirring constantly until mixture is thick and bubbly. Remove from heat- set aside. Cover with remaining potatoes. Bake for 20 minutes or until top is browned.

Cover chicken with water in a large pot. Cook 1 hour and remove chicken. Meanwhile, prepare remaining ingredients, and add to pot after removing chicken, and cook for 1 hour. Meanwhile, place chicken in baking dish and roast it in a 350 f oven for 30 minutes. After roasting, let chicken cool for 10 minutes before removing meat from the carcass and adding the meat to the soup pot. Simmer until the meat is heated through, and serve.

In a large saucepan, heat oil. Add sausage and cook until meat is no longer pink. Add shallots and garlic. Cook one minute. Add tomatoes, herbs and sugar. Bring to a fast boil, then simmer uncovered for 40 minutes. Stir frequently and skim off fat. Add salt and pepper. Serve over pasta.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Place cutlets on a baking sheet with wax paper between layers and freeze. When frozen, put in a ziploc bag and store in freezer until ready to use. Bake at 325 for 15 - 20 minutes.

Heat oil over medium heat. Saut garlic until soft, being careful not to let it burn. Add sliced mushrooms and saut until they look fairly cooked and shiny. Add almonds and saut for a couple more minutes. Finally, add frozen green beans and splash of soy sauce. Stir frequently until beans are just cooked and, of course, no longer frozen. If not on the south beach diet or watching sugar intake, you could add oyster sauce or other asian condiment to the mixture.

Slice avocado lengthwise. Remove pit and scoop avocado into a small bowl. Add mayonnaise, lime juice, worcestershire sauce, hot pepper sauce, garlic salt. Stir and mash the ingredients together until guacamole is preferred consistency. Serve immediately, or cover and refrigerate if desired.

In a large bowl, whisk mayonnaise, vinegar, onion, celery seed, salt and pepper until smooth. Add the avocado celery and red onion. Toss well until combined. Cover and refrigeratoe until well chilled. Serve chilled.

Wipe chicken with damp cloth and place in casserole dish. Mix oil, lemon juice, stock powder and seasoning together and drizzle over chicken. Add chicken portions, garlic cloves and rosemary. Roast in a preheated 200c oven for about 35 minutes. You will need to shake the pan from time to time during the cooking process to prevent sticking.
Sprinkle pork tenderloin with salt and pepper. Serve over polenta, egg noodles, or rice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Prepare a shallow baking dish with non-stick pan spray. Sprinkle the fish with lemon juice and place in the dish. Mince the garlic in a food processor or blender. Add the cilantro. Process until minced. Add the oil, salt, and pepper flakes. Process until well mixed. Spread the pesto evenly over the fish. Bake 10 minutes, or until the fish is opaque and flakes easily with a fork.

Heat olive oil in skillet and saut the shallots for 3-4 minutes. Remove the shallots and brown the pork from all sides. Add the brandy and let stand 2-3 minutes, turning the pork to avoid burning. Then add the juices, cover with the lid and let simmer in very low heat. After 1. 5 hour add the shallots, salt and pepper. 10 minutes before the meat is done. Put the florida red snapper fillets, onion, orange juice, lemon juice, orange rind, salt, nutmegpreparation:Heat olive oil in skillet and saut the shallots for 3-4 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350f. Mix flour, brown sugar, cocoa, baking soda, and salt with fork together. Mix in remaining ingredients except chocolate chips and pour into an ungreased 8x8x2-inch baking pan. Sprinkle chocolate chips over batter. Bake until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean, 35-40 minutes. Sprinkle with powdered sugar if desired. Bake until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean, 35-

In a saucepan, heat the oil, add the beans and mix with a little water, if needed, to thin the beans. Stir in onions, salt, garlic salt. Add cheese and allow to melt. Sprinkle with chiles. Heat until the beans are slightly thickened. Spoon into a dip bowl and serve with tortilla chips.

In a double-boiler melt chocolate. Remove from heat and add the sweetened condensed milk, vanilla, salt, and nuts. Stir until smooth. Turn into wax paper lined 8 inch square pan and chill in fridge. Store in cool place in an airtight container.
Grease 13 x 9 pan. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 1 hour, then uncover and bake until done.

Pour the brazilian mocha into a large mixing bowl. Gently stir in the brazilian mocha until dissolved. Gently stir in the vanilla. Gradually whisk in the brazilian mocha until no longer grainy, then briskly whisk until thick. Chill well before serving. Can be frozen.

Preheat oven to 425. In a saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add flour and stir thoroughly. Add chicken broth and cook until thickened. To the saucepan, add chicken, peas, carrots, onion and salt. Heat to boiling. Pour into a 1. 5 liter casserole. Top with uncooked biscuits. Bake at 425 8-10 minutes or until the biscuits are done.

In a large skillet combine bacon bits, fat-free evaporated milk, egg substitute, parmesan cheese, salt, white pepper, ground nutmeg. Bring to a boil over high heat. Add spaghetti and cook according to package directions. Just before pasta is done reheat sauce. Slice basil leaves and add to the sauce. Drain pasta and return to pot. Add sauce to pasta and toss. Serve.

In a tall thin glass, crush or muddle part of the mint with a fork to coat the inside. Add the sugar and lime juice and stir thoroughly. Top with ice. Add rum and mix. Top off with the club soda. Add a lime or lemon slice and the remaining mint. Serves one.

Mix together all ingredients. Store in a 1 cup canning jar or other airtight container. When ready to make dressing, combine 1 cup of mayonnaise, 1 cup buttermilk, and 1 tablespoon dry dressing mix. Whisk well. When ready to make dressing, combine 1 cup of mayonnaise, 1 cup but
In a large mixing bowl, beat eggs, chives, salt, & pepper. In a large skillet, melt butter over medium-low heat. Add eggs, chives, salt, & pepper. Add eggs, chives, salt, &

Preheat oven to 350f. Toss together berries and apples, spread evenly over bottom of 8x8 baking dish. In medium bowl combine sugar, flour, cinnamon and oats. Using pastry cutter work butter into oat mixture until crumbly. Spread over fruit, pressing down lightly. Bake 40-45 minutes or until top is lightly browned. Cool before serving. Top with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.

Drain pineapple juice and reserve. Combine pineapple chunks, peach slices, mandarin orange sections, apples, instant vanilla pudding, milk, frozen orange juice concentrate, sour cream. Combine pineapple chunks, peach slices, mandarin orange sections, apples, instant vanilla pudding,

In a wok or large frying pan over medium high heat, saute the spinach and garlic in the oil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Transfer to a platter in the same pan, heat the wine and saute the celery or bok choy and mushrooms, stirring constantly, for 3 minutes. Add the rice, scallions and spinach. Heat through. Season with soy sauce or tamari.

Mix all the ingredients together in a bowl. Heat up a frying pan. When the pan is hot, spoon the mixture in heaped spoonfuls into the pan. Cook in batches for about 3 minutes each side, or until both sides are golden brown. Remove from the pan, and continue cooking in batches.
Heat butter in skillet. Add chicken and cook until browned. Add soup, water, sugar and vinegar. Heat to a boil. Cover and cook over low heat 5 minute or until done. Serve over rice.

Mix all of the ingredients for the sauce in a small bowl. Brush over the chicken. Broil the chicken for 10 minutes each side, 2 inches or so from the heat. Brush frequently with the sauce. Bake for 1 hour. Remove from the oven and drizzle with the lemon juice of the last lemon, and a few more grinds from pepper mill.

Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium high heat. Add wing pieces and cook until golden brown on all sides, about 6 to 10 minutes. Drain excess liquid before adding sauce ingredients. Mix remaining ingredients and add to skillet, stirring to coat chicken well. Cook on medium heat until chicken is well coated and sauce thickens, about 8 to 10 minutes. You can also cook them in a crock pot, on low setting. The meat just falls off the bone.

Heat 1 cup of the milk in a medium saucepan over low heat. Add chocolate, stirring constantly, until melted. When the chocolate has melted, increase heat to medium and add the remainder of the milk while whisking rapidly. Do not allow to boil. Serve in small cups fortified with a jigger of peppermint schnapps and a dollop of whipped cream. Add a peppermint stick to stir. If transporting in a thermos, heat thermos up with hot water to get it warm for 1 minute. Pour water out and fill with hot chocolate.

Preheat oven to 350f grease cupcake tins with butter. Beat the eggs until lemon coloured. Add the sugar and butter and continue to beat until thick, then add the lemon rind. Pour warm milk into egg mixture while continuing to beat. Once blended, fold in the flour until well mixed. Fill the tins half way up and bake for approximately 1 hour, or until a tester inserted comes out clean. Cool in pans on a rack. Cupcakes will sink during the cooling process.

Heat the oil in a heavy pan over medium heat. Add the onions, celery ribs, cornbread, white bread, sage, chicken broth, eggs, salt and pepper. Cook for 3 minutes. Add the water, tomato sauce, salt and pepper. Heat to boiling. Stir in the rice. Reduce heat to simmer. Cook covered, until rice is tender, about 30 minutes. Remove from heat and keep covered until time to serve.

Spray nonstick skillet with cooking spray. Heat over med. Heat. Add potatoes, cheddar cheese, green onion, salsa, sour cream. Cook until desired doneness. Stir in potatoes, cheddar cheese, green onion, salsa, sour cream. Cook and stir 7 minutes. Spoon mixture on tortillas. Top with potatoes, cheddar cheese, green onion, salsa, sour cream. Cook and

Heat oil. Add onion & celery, cover and cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, for 20- 25 minutes or until the onion is slightly coloured. Sprinkle flour over onions& stir in. Slowly add the beer, pour in chicken stock and season to taste. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Place toast slices in ovenproof soup bowls. Pour broth into each bowl, sprinkle with some parsley& top with grated cheese. Place under broiler for a couple of minutes to melt cheese.

Preheat oven to 375f. Remove stem end of tomato and cut tomato into several large chunks, then coarsely chop. Stack salami slices, two at a time and cut into small wedges. Arrange the triangles on a flat baking stone or pizza pan so they do not touch. Sprinkle triangles with equal amounts of tomato, salami, cheese and oregano. Bake 15-18 minutes or until edges are golden brown.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Spray a baking sheet with nonstick spray. Slice the onions width wise and then break them apart into rings. Put the flour in 1 bowl, the egg whites into a second, and into the third put the bread crumbs and all the spices. Dip each onion ring into the flour, then the egg whites, and then the bread crumbs. Place them on the baking sheet and then repeat with the next ring. Bake them all for about 20 minutes or until crispy.

Cook chicken in skillet in hot oil 4 to 5 minutes or until browned. Stir in rice, tomatoes and salsa. Reduce heat to low. Cover. Simmer 8 to 10 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Sprinkle with shredded cheese. Continue cooking about 3 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Cook noodles according to pkg. Directions. Drain. Meanwhile saute the linguine in the chicken broth until tender, about 10 minutes. Add cooked noodles and mix well. Add salt, pepper, garlic powder to taste. Take the pan off the heat and fold in the sour cream.

Preheat oven to 325f. In a large bowl, beat together the eggs and sugar until very thick. The batter should fall from the beaters in a thick ribbon. Beat in the vanilla. While youre beating the eggs and sugar, heat the hot chocolate and butter in a small saucepan to just simmering. Add the hot chocolate mixture to the egg mixture in a slow, steady stream as you continue beating. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Fold the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients, stirring until theyre just combined. Pour the batter into a lightly greased 9 inch cake round. Bake for 50 minutes, or until the cake is a deep golden brown and starting to pull away from the sides of the pan. Remove the cake from the oven and cool it in the pan for 10-15 minutes. Remove the cake from the oven and cool it in

In a large skillet brown pork chops in oil and butter on each side. Remove the chops and keep warm. In the same skillet, saute the mushrooms, beans and garlic until vegetables are tender. Stir in the soup, water and pepper. Bring to a boil. Top with pork chops. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 10-15 minutes until pork juices run clear, stirring occasionally. Serve sauce over chops.

Heat oil over medium heat. Saut garlic until soft, being careful not to let it burn. Add sliced mushrooms and saut until they look fairly cooked and shiny. Add almonds and saut for a couple more minutes. Finally, add frozen green beans and splash of soy sauce. Stir frequently until beans are just cooked and, of course, no longer frozen. If not on the south beach diet or watching sugar intake, you could add oyster sauce or other asian condiment to the mixture.

Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly spray a baking sheet with vegetable oil spray and set aside. Sprinkle crumbs onto an ungreased baking sheet and set aside. Bake 5-7 minutes or until lightly browned. Combine bread crumbs, black pepper and parsley in a shallow pan and set aside. Raise oven temperature to 400f. Combine mayonnaise, water and hot pepper sauce in shallow bowl, mixing well. Dip fish in mayonnaise mixture and then dredge in bread crumbs. Place fish on greased baking sheet and bake in oven 17-18 or until fish flakes easily. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f mix together the chocolate chips, corn flakes, rolled oats, self raising flour, sultana, coconut, butter, egg, milk, butter, rolled oats, self raising flour, sultana, coconut, butter, egg, milk, butter, rolled oats, self raising flour, sultana, coconut, butter, egg, milk, butter, rolled oats, self raising flour, sultana, coconut, butter, egg, milk, butter, rolled oats, self raising flour, sultana, coconut, butter, egg, milk, butter, rolled oats, self raising flour, sultana, coconut, butter, egg, milk, butter, rolled oats, self raising flour, sultana, coconut, butter, egg, milk, butter, rolled oats, self raising flour, sultana, coconut, butter, egg, milk, butter, rolled oats, self raising flour, sultana, coconut, butter, egg, milk, butter, rolled oats, self raising flour, sultana, coconut, butter, egg, milk, butter, rolled oats, self raising flour, sultana, coconut, butter, egg, milk, butter, rolled oats, self raising flour, sultana, coconut, butter, egg, milk, butter, rolled oats, self raising flour, sultana, coconut, butter, egg, milk, butter, rolled oats, self raising flour, sultana, coconut, butter, egg, milk, butter, rolled oats, self raising flour, sultana, coconut, butter, egg, milk, butter, rolled oats, self raising flour, sultana, coconut, butter, egg, milk, butter, rolled oats, self raising flour, sultana, coconut, butter, egg, milk, butter, rolled oats, self raising flour, sultana, coconut, butter, egg, milk, butter, rolled oats, self raising flour, sultana, coconut, butter

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add eggs, sour cream, cheddar cheese, ham, onion, fresh mushrooms, green bell pepper, salt and pepper, butter. Beat with wire whisk until smooth. Pour over the ham and vegetable mixture in the skillet. Sprinkle the top with the cheese. Stir as it cooks until the eggs are no longer shiny.

Rinse rice thoroughly in a heavy stockpot. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, stirring occasionally, 15 to 20 minutes, or until all the liquid has been absorbed and the rice has fluffed.

Heat oil in lg skillet. Saute chicken until lightly browned. Add a little more oil if necessary. Return mushrooms to skillet. Add flour, salt and pepper. Cook and stir for 2 minutes. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 200 degree celsius. Mix eggs and sugar until thick and creamy. Combine cornflour, milk and vanilla essence and slowly add to egg and sugar mix beating as you do so. Spoon mixture into pastry shell and sprinkle with ground nutmeg. Bake at 200 degree celsius for 10 minutes, reduce heat to 180 degree celsius and bake for a further 20 to 25 minutes. Skewer inserted at centre should come out clean.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add the onions, sausages and pecans. Saut until onions are just softened, about 3 minutes. Add eggs and cook, stirring with a wooden spoon, until eggs are firm but not dry. Remove from heat and set aside. Meanwhile, heat a panini maker or a grill pan over medium-high heat. Divide sausage mixture into 4 portions and mound each portion on one slice of bread. Top each with bocconcini slices and top with remaining bread slices. Lightly butter the outside of each panini. Cook until both sides of each panini are golden. Serve immediately. Serve warm and garnish with maple syrup and fresh fruit if desired.

Heat the oil in a non-stick fry pan, add the sliced pepper and fry for 3-5 minutes. Stir in the garlic and chili and fry for 1-2 minutes until the garlic turns golden. Add the tomatoes, prawns and sherry mixture to the pan. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until the prawns are pink and firm. Sprinkle with parsley and season with pepper. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Lightly spray baking dish with cooking spray. In large bowl, combine soup, cheddar cheese, milk and black pepper. Add garlic and potatoes to soup mixture. Mix well. Spoon potatoes into baking dish. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and paprika. Cover with foil. Bake 1 hour. Remove foil. Bake and additional 15-20 minutes or until potatoes are tender.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 5 minutes. Add tomato and cook until fragrant, about 5 minutes. Add tomato
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.

Heat oil and a large pan and cook the brussels sprouts, stirring until the brussels sprouts are soft. Add the chicken stock, butter, flour, milk, nutmeg, heavy cream, tabasco sauce, salt and pepper. Cook until the brussels sprouts are soft. Add the chicken stock, butter, flour, milk, nutmeg, heavy

Mix cream cheese, sugar, semisweet baking chocolate, whipped topping, oreo cookies until smooth. Fold in cool whip. Spoon mixture into crust. Sprinkle cookie crumbles on top to taste. Refrigerate overnight.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line cookie sheet with parchment paper to keep from sticking. Combine flour, sugar and pepper in a gallon plastic bag. Put one bacon slice at a time in bag and shake to coat well. Place bacon on the cookie sheet so they are not touching each other. Bake for 30-40 minutes at 350 degrees. Drain on paper towels.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees and bake for 20-25 minutes.
Heat skillet over medium high heat. Add beef broth and stir. Add horseradish and mustard. Cook, stirring constantly, until mixture is heated. Serve over tenderloin.

Combine all ingredients except the salmon or chicken in a container that can be sealed. Mix together well. Add the salmom or chicken and marinate at least 1 hour, turning once. Drain and discard marinade. Place salmon skin side down on grill for 15-20 minutes. You may also broil salmon or chicken for 20-30 minutes.

Place chicken, skin side down, in a large baking dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Combine remaining ingredients. Mix well. Pour mixture over chicken. Bake, uncovered, at 375 degrees for 30 minutes turn pieces and bake 20 minutes longer or until chicken is glazed and no longer pink.

Heat 1 cup of the milk in a medium saucepan over low heat. Add chocolate, stirring constantly, until melted. When the chocolate has melted, increase heat to medium and add the remainder of the milk while whisking rapidly. Do not allow to boil. Serve in small cups fortified with a jigger of peppermint schnapps and a dollop of whipped cream. Add a peppermint stick to stir. If transporting in a thermos, heat thermos up with hot water to get it warm for 1 minute. Pour water out and fill with hot chocolate.

Cook spaghetti according to package instructions. While the spaghetti is cooking, heat a large saut pan over medium heat with olive oil. Saut green peppers. Add tomatoes and herbs once pepper softens. Heat until warm. Combine pasta and tomato mixture. Sprinkle cheese on top and fold edges of pasta toward the center. Transfer to plate, stir, and serve.

Preheat the broiler. Place frozen corn on a broiler pan and place under the broiler, turning occasionally, until the skins become blackened. Remove from the oven and place in a paper bag or cover with foil until cool enough to handle. Using a sharp knife, peel off and dispose of the charred skins. Core and seed the corn. Cut each corn into 8-10 long strips. Place in a bowl. In a small bowl stir together the oil and garlic. Seed and stem the corn. Pour oil mixture over the corn, toss, cover and refrigerate until chilled. Refreshing with grilled or broiled meats.
In a large saucepan, combine butter, egg, raisins and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and simmer for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and simmer

Wash and trim the sprouts, cut an x in the core end. In a large saucepan, bring 1 inch of water and the sprouts to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 10 to 12 minutes or until fork tender. In a small microwave safe dish, melt the butter and blend in lemon juice, dill weed and lemon zest. Drain the sprouts, return to pan and dry over heat for 1 to 2 minutes. Pour the butter mixture over, tossing to coat, stir in chopped almonds. Enjoy.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees, line pan with parchment paper. Place squash on pan cut side up. Combine remaining ingredients and brush half of the mixture on the squash. Bake for 45 minute or until tender. Brush once more halfway through baking, and again near the end.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. Peel and trim onions and garlic slices. Roast at 350 for 30 minutes, stirring half way through. Turn up oven to 425 and roast ten minutes longer or until the ends of the onions begin to turn black. When onions are almost done, melt apricot jam in microwave for 15-30 seconds. Remove onions from oven, place in bowl and toss warm onions with melted apricot jam. Toss with a little more rosemary if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place sprouts, butter, and potatoes on a rimmed baking sheet. Season with salt and pepper. Toss to combine. Roast, stirring, until golden brown and tender, 35 to 40 minutes. Transfer to a serving bowl. Immediately dress with honey and lemon juice, and season with salt and pepper. Serve warm or at room temperature.
Place chicken pieces of choice in a gallon ziplock bag. Add the sauce mixture. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit until done, 50 to 60 minutes.

Heat oven to 400f grease cookie sheet. In medium bowl, stir honey, peanut butter, powdered milk, unsweetened coconut, sesame seeds, toasted sesame seeds. Stir well. Shape into small balls. Place onto a ungreased cookie sheet. Flatten with a glass. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Bake in 350 degree oven for 8-10 minutes. Makes 4 dozen.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix butter, flour, sugar, baking powder, lemon juice, milk, nutmeg, cinnamon, peaches and cinnamon. Pour over top of fruit. Pour melted butter of top. Place in oven and cook for 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cook pork chops in canola oil. While pork chops are browning, layer simply potatoes homestyle slices in casserole dish. Spread onion slices over potatoes. Place pork chips, along with pan drippings, on top of onions and potatoes. Pour can of diced tomatoes over pork chops. Bake 350 for 45 minutes or until meat and potatoes are done.
